title: Justin Verlander: ‘I want to hang out with’ Texans quarterback Deshaun Watson
text:
CLOSE

So, who pays for dinner?

Two of Houston's biggest sports stars - Astros ace Justin Verlander and Texans quarterback Deshaun Watson - have become good buddies.

"He's an incredible man," said Verlander before Game 4 of the American League Championship Series in the Bronx. "I think it's been a lot of fun.

”Obviously being in the same city and just kind of being in the spotlight like he is, I guess we just kind of relate that way.”

Justin Verlander is scheduled to start Game 5 of the ALCS. (Photo: Thomas Shea, USA TODAY Sports)

"Honestly, I was blown away after the first time meeting him, just his demeanor, how smart he was, his charisma, all the things that you want to see in a young athlete.

Despite the difference in age -- Verlander, 36, and Watson, 24 -- the two superstars have been seen on the social scene and have a lot in common when it comes to their day jobs. The two have built a friendship and often have dinner together, according to Bleacher Report.

The Cy Young winner emphasized he's not Watson's mentor, rather just a good friend.

"It's not like I'm trying to mentor him," Verlander added. "He's just an awesome person that I want to hang out with. He is an awesome dude."
description: Astros ace Justin Verlander says Texans quarterback Deshaun Watson is an 'awesome dude' and the two Houston superstars have become close friends.
